page.title: 10HEALTH IN TIDWORTH
page.content: Due to the military population of Tidworth we have Army medical services as well as the National Health Service. The NHS provides a doctors' surgery at the Community Centre and a Health Centre on Station Road. Child Health Clinics are held regularly at Ordnance House. The Royal Army Medical Corps (RAMC) runs a group practice at St. Andrews Road and the Medical Reception Station (MRS) at Jamrud Road. The MRS gives 'out-of-hours' emergency cover. The dependants of military personnel may choose to be treated under the NHS or RAMC. Dental Clinics are run by the Army and there is a civilian dentist on Pennings Road (A338). Hampshire County Council also runs a school dental service and schoolchildren are given free treatment if required. Civilians are treated by the National Health Service
